decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo of Inverter of Truth and Thassa's Oracle to win the game. The deck contains a lot of card filtering and removal spells to control the game until the combo can be executed. Key cards include Dig Through Time for card advantage, Thoughtseize for disruption, and Jace, Vryn's Prodigy for card selection. The deck aims to quickly find and play Inverter of Truth, then play Thassa's Oracle to win the game by putting their entire library into their graveyard.

The main focus of this Sultai Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while grinding out card advantage and value over time. Using cards like Fatal Push, Thoughtseize, and Abrupt Decay to handle threats, and cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Tireless Tracker to generate card advantage. The deck also has a variety of win conditions, such as Emrakul, the Promised End and Nissa, Who Shakes the World, to close out games. The deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent until it can establish a winning position.

The main concept of this Aggro-Weenie White deck in Pioneer 1 vs 1 is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient creature presence, supported by key cards like Heliod, Sun-Crowned, Walking Ballista, and Knight of the White Orchid. The deck utilizes Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx and Idyllic Grange for mana acceleration and board presence, while also including removal options like Stasis Snare and Baffling End for control. Gideon's Intervention and Gideon of the Trials provide protection and disruption, allowing the deck to maintain pressure and tempo throughout the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using low-cost and efficient creatures and burn spells. With the combination of powerful cards like Torbran, Thane of Red Fell and Soul-Scar Mage, the deck aims to maximize damage output while maintaining board presence. The inclusion of cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Ramunap Ruins provides additional value in punishing opponents for playing spells and dealing direct damage beyond just creature combat. The deck's strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with fast-paced aggression and burn spells to secure a quick victory.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, aiming to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The deck focuses on utilizing cards like Wild Slash, Lightning Strike, and Ramunap Ruins to control the board and clear a path for creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster and Monastery Swiftspear to deal direct damage. Additionally, cards like Torbran, Thane of Red Fell and Soul-Scar Mage enhance the damage output of the deck, while also utilizing cards like Castle Embereth for extra damage. The goal is to apply constant pressure and finish off the opponent before they can stabilize.

This Winota combo deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with creatures like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves to cast Winota, Joiner of Forces and cheat out powerful creatures like Angrath's Marauders and Legion Warboss. With cards like Eldritch Evolution and Gilded Goose for additional utility, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive strategy. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the combo while providing necessary colors for spells. This deck seeks to quickly assemble its combo pieces and win the game before the opponent can react effectively.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Lotus Field and various land tutors, allowing the player to effectively utilize powerful combo pieces like Underworld Breach and Fae of Wishes to quickly assemble a winning board state or find the necessary answers to stabilize the game. By efficiently cycling through the deck and manipulating mana sources, the deck aims to generate overwhelming advantage and overwhelm the opponent before they can establish their own game plan.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with low-cost creatures while using support cards like Elspeth Conquers Death and Stasis Snare to control the board. The key strategy is to establish a strong board presence early with cards like Thraben Inspector and Knight of the White Orchid, while using cards like Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Gideon of the Trials to boost team power. Karn, the Great Creator is used to access artifacts and disrupt opponent's strategies, making this deck a versatile and aggressive force to be reckoned with.

This deck focuses on using cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the board early on, while setting up the combo of Inverter of Truth and Thassa's Oracle to win the game in one turn by putting your entire library into your graveyard and winning instantly. Cards like Dig Through Time and Jace, Wielder of Mysteries help dig for the combo pieces and ensure a smooth win condition. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while quickly assembling its own combo to secure victory.

This aggressive Red Deck Wins Pioneer deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent through efficient burn spells and hasty creatures. With a strong emphasis on low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Chainwhirler, supported by powerful enchantments like Torbran, Thane of Red Fell and Eidolon of the Great Revel, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and finish the game before they can stabilize. The inclusion of direct damage spells like Wild Slash and Lightning Strike further adds to the deck's ability to maintain pressure and close out games swiftly.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize Lotus Field and various untap effects to generate a large amount of mana quickly. Cards like Strategic Planning and Pore Over the Pages help dig through the deck to find key combo pieces like Underworld Breach and Fae of Wishes. By generating a large amount of mana and utilizing untap effects, the deck can loop spells and win conditions to eventually win the game through a combo finish with Thassa's Oracle or other win conditions.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of hand disruption, removal spells, board wipes, and powerful planeswalkers. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan, maintain control of the board, and eventually win through incremental advantage or a powerful finisher like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The addition of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value through blinking permanents and generating card advantage. The deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents with a well-rounded suite of control tools.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on utilizing a variety of removal spells and hand disruption to control the game, while also using graveyard recursion with cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and The Scarab God. The deck also includes card selection with Satyr Wayfinder and Grisly Salvage, as well as card advantage engines like Tireless Tracker and Jace, Vryn's Prodigy. The inclusion of Emrakul, the Promised End as a finisher adds a powerful threat to the deck's late-game plan. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outgrind its opponents through card advantage and control elements.

This deck focuses on assembling a combo utilizing various legendary creatures and artifacts to mill through the deck and win the game by drawing cards with Jace, Wielder of Mysteries. The key strategy involves using Kethis, the Hidden Hand and Emry, Lurker of the Loch to repeatedly cast historic spells from the graveyard, generating mana with Mox Amber and Springleaf Drum. Liliana, the Last Hope and Lazav, the Multifarious provide additional utility, while Teferi, Time Raveler disrupts opponents' game plans. Wishclaw Talisman can be used to search for key combo pieces.

The main concept of this Dimir Inverter deck is to control the game with interactive spells like Opt, Fatal Push, and Thoughtseize, while digging through the deck with cards like Dig Through Time and Cling to Dust. The ultimate goal is to assemble the combo of casting Inverter of Truth to swap the graveyard and library, followed by playing Thassa's Oracle or Jace, Wielder of Mysteries to win the game instantly by having no cards left in the library. This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up and executing a powerful win condition.

This deck focuses on quickly turning artifacts into powerful creatures with Ensoul Artifact and Skilled Animator, then utilizing cards like Shrapnel Blast and Ghostfire Blade to deal damage efficiently. It also includes protection spells like Stubborn Denial and Dive Down to keep your creatures safe. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive artifact creatures like Stonecoil Serpent and Gingerbrute, while also having the option to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Hope of Ghirapur. The mana base is designed to support casting both artifacts and colored spells effectively.
